cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE. 

This paper deals with the task of sentiment analysis, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP). The paper proposes an end-to-end machine learning architecture for attitude identification, which involves both target detection and polarity classification. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL). 

The proposed architecture involves deep memory networks, which are a type of neural network that can store and retrieve information over long periods of time. This suggests that the paper is also likely to belong to the sub-category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI), which deals with the development of intelligent agents that can learn from data. 

The paper also involves the use of machine learning techniques, such as deep learning and conventional machine learning methods. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG), which deals with the development of algorithms that can learn from data. 

The paper also involves the use of information retrieval techniques, such as target detection and polarity classification. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of Information Retrieval (cs.IR), which deals with the development of algorithms that can retrieve relevant information from large collections of data.
